laws.summary: Avoid overshadowing those in power, as it may provoke their envy and resentment.

laws.law: Never Put Too Much Trust in Friends
laws.summary: Be cautious of trusting others completely, as they may betray or disappoint you.
Keep your plans and motives hidden to maintain an advantage over others.
Avoid revealing too much information, as it can be used against you.
Cultivate a strong reputation, as it can enhance your influence and protect you from attacks.
Stand out from the crowd and draw attention to yourself to gain power.

laws.law: Get Others to Do the Work for You
laws.summary: Delegate tasks and responsibilities to others, while you take credit for their achievements.

laws.law: Make Other People Come to You
laws.summary: Create an aura of importance that compels others to seek your favor.

laws.law: Win Through Actions, Never Through Argument
laws.summary: Demonstrate your capabilities through actions rather than engaging in fruitless debates.
Avoid negative and toxic individuals, as their influence can harm your power and reputation.

laws.law: Learn to Keep People Dependent on You
laws.summary: Make yourself indispensable to others, ensuring they rely on you for their needs.
Deploy honesty and generosity strategically to gain advantages in your interactions.

laws.law: When Asking for Help, Appeal to Self-Interest
laws.summary: Frame your requests in a way that highlights the benefits others will gain by assisting you.

laws.law: Pose as a Friend, Work as a Spy
laws.summary: Appear friendly while secretly gathering information that can be used to your advantage.
Avoid leaving remnants of resistance, as they may rise again to challenge your power.

laws.law: Use Absence to Increase Respect and Honor
laws.summary: Withdraw from the spotlight occasionally to create a sense of importance and mystery.
Instill a level of uncertainty and unpredictability to keep others on their toes.

laws.law: Do Not Build Fortresses to Protect Yourself
laws.summary: Avoid isolating yourself, as it breeds resentment and undermines your power.
Understand the people you interact with to anticipate their actions and counteract them effectively.
Maintain flexibility and avoid being tied down to one person or group.

laws.law: Play a Sucker to Catch a Sucker
laws.summary: Lure others into underestimating you to gain an advantage over them.
Give the illusion of yielding to the desires of others while manipulating the situation to your benefit.
Direct your efforts and resources strategically to maximize their impact.
Observe the social dynamics and power structures within a group, and adapt your behavior accordingly.
Continually reinvent yourself to stay relevant and adaptable in changing circumstances.
Avoid direct involvement in controversial or unethical actions that could harm your reputation.

laws.law: Play on People's Need to Believe
laws.summary: Exploit people's desire for something to believe in to gain their loyalty and support.
Act decisively and boldly, as hesitation can lead to missed opportunities and weakened power.

laws.law: Plan All the Way to the End
laws.summary: Anticipate potential obstacles and outcomes, and plan your actions accordingly.
Downplay the effort behind your achievements to maintain an air of natural talent.
Manipulate the choices available to others to ensure they select the one that benefits you.

laws.law: Be the Master of Your Own Image
laws.summary: Craft and control your public image to shape others' perceptions of you.
Identify others' weaknesses and vulnerabilities to gain leverage over them.

laws.law: Be Royal in Your Own Fashion
laws.summary: Define your own standards of behavior and live by them, disregarding conventional norms.
Seize opportunities at the right moment to maximize their impact.
Display indifference towards what you cannot obtain to maintain your power and dignity.
Stage grand gestures and events to captivate and control the attention of others.

laws.law: Think as You Like, but Behave Like Others
laws.summary: Adapt your behavior to fit social expectations, while preserving your true thoughts and beliefs.

laws.law: Stir Up Waters to Catch Fish
laws.summary: Create chaos or conflict to exploit the opportunities that arise from it.
Be wary of accepting favors or gifts, as they may come with hidden obligations and expectations.

laws.law: Avoid Stepping into a Great Man's Shoes
laws.summary: Do not try to replace or emulate a powerful figure directly, as it invites comparison and resistance.

laws.law: Strike the Shepherd and the Sheep Will Scatter
laws.summary: Target the influential figures within a group to weaken their followers' loyalty.

laws.law: Work on the Hearts and Minds of Others
laws.summary: Appeal to people's emotions and desires to sway their opinions and gain their support.

laws.law: Disarm and Infuriate with the Mirror Effect
laws.summary: Reflect others' behavior and attitudes back at them to disarm and manipulate them.

laws.law: Preach the Need for Change, but Never Reform Too Much at Once
laws.summary: Advocate for change to gain support, but implement it gradually to avoid resistance.
Display minor flaws or weaknesses to appear more relatable and less threatening to others.

laws.law: Do Not Go Past the Mark You Aimed For
laws.summary: Avoid overreaching in your pursuits, as it can lead to backlash and loss of power.
Adapt your strategies and actions to fit the circumstances, remaining flexible and elusive.
